page.title: 11Earl of Scarbrough,Oldcotes
page.content: There has been an{Earl of Scarbrough since the 12th century. The present earl is the twelfth{Earl of Scarbrough and his name is Richard Aldred Lumley and he was born in 1932. He has been earl since 1969. His titles are{Baron {Lumley and Viscount Lumley.}The{Lumley family have been the earls since the 15th April 1690 because they were loyal to the king when{Charles 1st}got his head cut off. In 1862 the{Earl of {Scarbrough}owned 5866 acres of land in South Yorkshire and Nottingshire with mainly wheat in. Most of his land is in the parishes of Maltby and Tickhill He lives at{Sandbeck Park}near {Rotherham}and also has a town house in {London.}He owns{Clatticar Woods}in {Oldcotes.}He has twenty acres of land bordering Oldcotes and Firbeck on which he is growing wheat this year to be sold to make flour for bread.
